title.value: Propositional Logics for the Lawvere Quantale
title.justification: The provided text covers details about propositional logics for the Lawvere quantale.
title.quote: Propositional Logics for the Lawvere Quantale

extractions.description: The paper investigates three [0, ∞]-valued propositional logics interpreted over the Lawvere quantale. These logics aim to provide a foundation for quantitative metric reasoning by incorporating basic logical connectives that can be interpreted in any quantale. The paper further develops natural deduction systems for these logics, proving their decidable completeness with respect to the quantale-valued semantics, and discusses the consistency of these logics. Moreover, the work shows incompleteness results and provides a normalization algorithm, establishing the decidability of satisfiability within these systems. Special attention is given to quantitative equational logic, indicating how it can be interpreted within one of these proposed logics, supporting theories with axiomatic systems or inference systems.

type.justification: The paper primarily focuses on the development and analysis of new logical systems and their properties, without conducting empirical experiments.
type.quote: In this paper, we propose studying logic over Lawvere’s quantale, and we begin such a study with propositional logic. An argument that points towards this quantale comes also from the literature on quantitative algebras.

name.justification: The paper focuses on propositional logics, natural deduction systems, and completeness proofs, which are central to theoretical informatics.
name.quote: In this paper, we investigate three [0, ∞]-valued propositional logics over the Lawvere quantale.

name.justification: The paper discusses logics for quantitative metric reasoning and their decidable completeness.
name.quote: Towards seeking a logic for quantitative metric reasoning, we investigate three [0, ∞]-valued propositional logics over the Lawvere quantale.

name.justification: The work focuses on developing natural deduction systems, proving completeness, and discussing consistency and normalization in propositional logics.
name.quote: The statement of enrichment is a quantitative analogue of being a preorder. Towards seeking a logic for quantitative metric reasoning, we investigate three [0, ∞]-valued propositional logics over the Lawvere quantale.
